decreases go on diagonally until you have 48/60/72 remaining sts on your needles sl the remaining sts on the 6th / 3rd needle evenly to the needles 1 and 4 if you use markers place one in the center of the sole and slip it each round put away the 6th / 3rd needle when there are 8 sts from the center of the sole to the cabling in the same round open up another row of diagonals work to 4 sts to the center of the sole rc k4 lc go on see sole pattern 1 in the next row work to 5 sts to the center of the sole rc k6 lc continue doing cables expanding the diagonals to the side of the sock each ends at the last st of the 1st needle or the 1st st of the 4th needle they are done in every row after you are done with the decreases the next diagonal starts when the previous diagonal is 8 sts away from the center of the sole at about 8/9/10 cm 3/3 5/4 in before the total length of the sock change direction of the cables to form a rectangle see sole pattern 2 and photo on page 2 the diagonal stops 3 sts before the center of the sole 2 sts to the center of the sole are left the following diagonal starts when the previous diagonal is 6 sts away from the last st of the 1st needle or the first st of the 4th needle 4 sts in stockinette between them like before toe with mostly invisible decreases start the toe about 4/4 5/5 cm 1 5/1 75/2 in before the desired length start in a round with the 4th or 7th row of the front chart start with the decreases at the front pattern not from bor then start with the decreases on the sole with the other yarn do the decreases at the front chart see special stitches and video https //youtu be/fdno3jiweko work to bor in the next round ssk and k2tog instead of cabling the outer diagonal of the sole go on with the front and sole pattern the st reductions in the front pattern are repeated 4/6/7 times in total on the soles they are done s 1x in every 3rd 2x in every 2nd round 8 sts on each needle m 1x in every 4th 2x in every 3rd and 3
